gui

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates all functionality to draw a map of the overall maze, the set of visible walls, the solution. The map is drawn on the screen in such a way that the current position remains at the center of the screen. The current position is visualized as a red dot with an attached arc for its current direction. The solution is visualized as a yellow line from the current position towards the exit of the map. Walls that have been visible in the first person view are drawn white, all other walls that were never shown before are drawn in grey. It is possible to zoom in and out of the map by increasing or decreasing the map scale. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    • Field Detail

      • viewWidth

        final int viewWidth

      • viewHeight

        final int viewHeight

      • mapUnit

        final int mapUnit

      • stepSize

        final int stepSize

      • mapScale

        int mapScale
        The user can increment or decrement the scale of the map. map_scale is used to keep track of the current setting. Minimum value is 1.

      • seenWalls

        final Floorplan seenWalls
        SeenWalls contains information on walls that are seen from the current point of view. The field is set by the constructor. The referenced object is shared with the FirstPersonDrawer that writes content into it. The MapDrawer only reads content to decide which lines to draw and in which color.

      • maze

        final Maze maze
        Contains all necessary information about current maze, i.e. cells: location of wallboards dists: distance to exit width and height of the maze

      • draw

        public void draw(MazePanel panel,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int angle,
                 int walkStep,
                 boolean showMaze,
                 boolean showSolution)
        Draws the current map on top of the first person view. Method assumes that we are in the playing state and that the map mode is switched on.
        Parameters:
        panel -
        x -
        y -
        angle -
        walkStep - is a counter between 0, 1, 2, ..., 3 for in between stages for a walk operation, needed to obtain exact location in map
        showMaze - if true, highlights already seen walls in white
        showSolution - if true shows a path to the exit as a yellow line, otherwise path is not shown.

      • getViewDX

        private int getViewDX(int angle)

      • getViewDY

        private int getViewDY(int angle)

      • radify

        final double radify(int x)

      • drawMap

        private void drawMap(java.awt.Graphics g,
                     int px,
                     int py,
                     int walkStep,
                     int viewDX,
                     int viewDY,
                     boolean showMaze,
                     boolean showSolution)
        Helper method for draw, called if map_mode is true, i.e. the users wants to see the overall map. The map is drawn only on a small rectangle inside the maze area such that only a part of the map is actually shown. Of course a part covering the current location needs to be displayed. The current cell is (px,py). There is a viewing direction (view_dx, view_dy).
        Parameters:
        g - graphics handler to manipulate screen
        px - current position, x index
        py - current position, y index

      • getMaximum

        private int getMaximum(int offset,
                       int viewLength,
                       int mazeLength)
        Obtains the maximum for a given offset
        Parameters:
        offset - either in x or y direction
        viewLength - is either viewWidth or viewHeight
        mazeLength - is either mazeWidth or mazeHeight
        Returns:
        maximum that is bounded by mazeLength

      • drawCurrentLocation

        private void drawCurrentLocation(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                                 int viewDX,
                                 int viewDY)
        Draws a red circle at the center of the screen and an arrow for the current direction. It always reside on the center of the screen. The map drawing moves if the user changes location. The size of the overall visualization is limited by the size of a single cell to avoid that the circle or arrow visually collide with an adjacent wallboard on the map visualization.
        Parameters:
        gc - to draw on

      • drawArrow

        private void drawArrow(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                       int viewDX,
                       int viewDY,
                       int startX,
                       int startY)
        Draws an arrow either in horizontal or vertical direction.
        Parameters:
        gc - to draw on
        viewDX - is the current viewing direction, x coordinate
        viewDY - is the current viewing direction, y coordinate
        startX - is the x coordinate of the starting point
        startY - is the y coordinate of the starting point

      • drawSolution

        private void drawSolution(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                          int offsetX,
                          int offsetY,
                          int px,
                          int py)
        Draws a yellow line to show the solution on the overall map. Method is only called if in state playing and map_mode and showSolution are true. Since the current position is fixed at the center of the screen, all lines on the map are drawn with some offset.
        Parameters:
        gc - to draw lines on
        offsetX - is the offset for x coordinates
        offsetY - is the offset for y coordinates
        px - is the current position, an index x for a cell
        py - is the current position, an index y for a cell
